name: Dexteria
description: Dexteria is an AI-driven desktop application for project planning and execution. It provides a local-first Kanban board with an integrated AI agent named Dexter that can autonomously execute tasks.
purpose: To create a powerful, privacy-focused project management tool where an AI agent can understand project context, manage tasks, write code, and execute work items autonomously while keeping all data local.

architecture.overview: Electron desktop app with separate main and renderer processes
architecture.main_process: src/main/ - Electron main process handling IPC, file system, and agent runtime
architecture.renderer_process: src/renderer/ - React-based UI for Kanban board, chat, and task management
architecture.shared: src/shared/ - TypeScript types and schemas shared between processes
architecture.preload: src/main/preload.ts - Secure IPC bridge using context isolation
architecture.project_brain: .local-kanban/ - JSON-based storage for all project data

devWorkflow.development: npm run dev - Runs Vite dev server + Electron concurrently
devWorkflow.build: npm run build - Builds renderer with Vite, compiles main with TypeScript
devWorkflow.package: npm run package - Creates distributable using electron-builder
devWorkflow.typecheck: npm run typecheck - Validates TypeScript without emitting

constraints: Must work offline - all data stored locally in .local-kanban/
Agent operations must respect policy.json restrictions

shortTerm: Build chat interface for agent interaction
Implement basic file tools for agent
